FT.CREATE.summary: Creates an index with the given spec
FT.CREATE.complexity: O(K) at creation where K is the number of fields, O(N) if scanning the keyspace is triggered, where N is the number of keys in the keyspace
history: Added `PAYLOAD_FIELD` argument for backward support of `FT.SEARCH` deprecated `WITHPAYLOADS` argument

arguments.name: index
arguments.summary: Specifies the name of the index.

arguments.name: data_type
arguments.summary: Specifies the type of data to index, such as HASH or JSON.

arguments.name: prefix
prefix
arguments.summary: Filters indexed documents to include only keys that start with the specified prefix.
Filters indexed documents to include only keys that start with the specified prefix.

arguments.name: filter
arguments.summary: Applies a numeric range filter to restrict results to documents with field values within the specified range.

arguments.name: default_lang
arguments.summary: Defines the default language for the index.

arguments.name: lang_attribute
arguments.summary: Specifies the attribute from which the language is determined.

arguments.name: default_score
arguments.summary: Sets the default score for documents in the index.

arguments.name: score_attribute
arguments.summary: Specifies the attribute from which the score is derived.

arguments.name: payload_attribute
arguments.summary: Defines the attribute used for payloads in the index.

arguments.name: maxtextfields
arguments.summary: Increases the maximum number of text fields allowed in the schema.

arguments.name: seconds
arguments.summary: Specifies the duration (in seconds) for which the index remains active (temporary index).

arguments.name: nooffsets
arguments.summary: Disables storage of term offsets for index entries.

arguments.name: nohl
arguments.summary: Disables support for highlighting in search results.

arguments.name: nofields
arguments.summary: Omits returning fields from search results.

arguments.name: nofreqs
arguments.summary: Disables storage of term frequencies in the index.

arguments.name: stopwords
arguments.summary: Defines custom stop words for the index, which will be ignored during full-text search.

arguments.name: skipinitialscan
arguments.summary: Skips the initial scan of the database when creating the index.

arguments.name: schema
arguments.summary: Defines the fields in the index and their properties, such as type (`TEXT`, `TAG`, `NUMERIC`, etc.).

arguments.name: field
arguments.summary: Specifies a field in the index schema with its properties.

FT.INFO.summary: Returns information and statistics on the index

arguments.name: index
arguments.summary: Specifies the name of the index. The index must be created using `FT.CREATE`.

FT.EXPLAIN.summary: Returns the execution plan for a complex query

arguments.name: index
arguments.summary: Specifies the name of the index. The index must be created using `FT.CREATE`.

arguments.name: query
arguments.summary: Specifies the query to profile and analyze performance.

arguments.name: dialect
arguments.summary: Sets the query dialect version to be used.

FT.EXPLAINCLI.summary: Returns the execution plan for a complex query

arguments.name: index
arguments.summary: Specifies the name of the index. The index must be created using `FT.CREATE`.

arguments.name: query
arguments.summary: Specifies the query to profile and analyze performance.

arguments.name: dialect
arguments.summary: Sets the query dialect version to be used.

FT.ALTER.summary: Adds a new field to the index
FT.ALTER.complexity: O(N) where N is the number of keys in the keyspace

arguments.name: index
arguments.summary: Specifies the name of the index. The index must be created using `FT.CREATE`.

arguments.name: skipinitialscan
arguments.summary: Skips the initial scan of the database when creating the index.

arguments.name: schema
arguments.summary: Defines the fields in the index and their properties, such as type (`TEXT`, `TAG`, `NUMERIC`, etc.).

arguments.name: field
arguments.summary: Specifies a field in the index schema with its properties.

FT.DROPINDEX.complexity: O(1) or O(N) if documents are deleted, where N is the number of keys in the keyspace

arguments.name: index
arguments.summary: Specifies the name of the index. The index must be created using `FT.CREATE`.

FT.ALIASADD.summary: Adds an alias to the index

arguments.name: index
arguments.summary: Specifies the name of the index. The index must be created using `FT.CREATE`.

FT.ALIASUPDATE.summary: Adds or updates an alias to the index

arguments.name: index
arguments.summary: Specifies the name of the index. The index must be created using `FT.CREATE`.

FT.ALIASDEL.summary: Deletes an alias from the index

FT.TAGVALS.summary: Returns the distinct tags indexed in a Tag field

arguments.name: index
arguments.summary: Specifies the name of the index. The index must be created using `FT.CREATE`.

FT.SUGADD.summary: Adds a suggestion string to an auto-complete suggestion dictionary

FT.SUGGET.summary: Gets completion suggestions for a prefix

arguments.name: prefix
arguments.summary: Filters indexed documents to include only keys that start with the specified prefix.

arguments.name: withscores
arguments.summary: Includes the relative scores of each document in the search results.

FT.SUGDEL.summary: Deletes a string from a suggestion index

FT.SUGLEN.summary: Gets the size of an auto-complete suggestion dictionary

FT.SYNUPDATE.summary: Creates or updates a synonym group with additional terms

arguments.name: index
arguments.summary: Specifies the name of the index. The index must be created using `FT.CREATE`.

arguments.name: skipinitialscan
arguments.summary: Skips the initial scan of the database when creating the index.

FT.SYNDUMP.summary: Dumps the contents of a synonym group

arguments.name: index
arguments.summary: Specifies the name of the index. The index must be created using `FT.CREATE`.

FT.SPELLCHECK.summary: Performs spelling correction on a query, returning suggestions for misspelled terms

arguments.name: index
arguments.summary: Specifies the name of the index. The index must be created using `FT.CREATE`.

arguments.name: query
arguments.summary: Specifies the query to profile and analyze performance.

arguments.name: dialect
arguments.summary: Sets the query dialect version to be used.

FT.DICTDUMP.summary: Dumps all terms in the given dictionary
FT.DICTDUMP.complexity: O(N), where N is the size of the dictionary

FT._LIST.summary: Returns a list of all existing indexes

FT.CONFIG HELP.summary: Help description of runtime configuration options

FT.SEARCH.summary: Searches the index with a textual query, returning either documents or just ids

arguments.name: index
arguments.summary: Specifies the name of the index. The index must be created using `FT.CREATE`.

arguments.name: query
arguments.summary: Specifies the query to profile and analyze performance.

arguments.name: nocontent
arguments.summary: Returns only the document IDs in the search results, excluding the content.

arguments.name: verbatim
arguments.summary: Searches using the exact query terms without stemming or query expansion.

arguments.name: withscores
arguments.summary: Includes the relative scores of each document in the search results.

arguments.name: withsortkeys
arguments.summary: Returns the sorting key value alongside the document ID.

arguments.name: filter
arguments.summary: Applies a numeric range filter to restrict results to documents with field values within the specified range.

arguments.name: field
arguments.summary: Specifies a field in the index schema with its properties.

arguments.name: summarize
field
arguments.summary: Specifies a field in the index schema with its properties.
Splits a field into contextual fragments surrounding the found terms, Note that summarize for JSON documents is not currently supported.

arguments.name: highlight
highlight
arguments.summary: Highlights terms in the search results, with customizable tags for emphasis.

arguments.name: field
arguments.summary: Specifies a field in the index schema with its properties.
Highlights terms in the search results, with customizable tags for emphasis. Note that highlight for JSON documents is not currently supported.

arguments.name: timeout
arguments.summary: Sets a time limit for query execution, specified in milliseconds.

arguments.name: language
arguments.summary: Specifies the default language for full-text search, influencing stemming and stop-word behavior.

arguments.name: dialect
arguments.summary: Sets the query dialect version to be used.

FT.AGGREGATE.summary: Run a search query on an index and perform aggregate transformations on the results

arguments.name: index
arguments.summary: Specifies the name of the index. The index must be created using `FT.CREATE`.

arguments.name: query
arguments.summary: Specifies the query to profile and analyze performance.

arguments.name: verbatim
arguments.summary: Searches using the exact query terms without stemming or synonym expansion.

arguments.name: field
arguments.summary: Specifies a field in the index schema with its properties.

arguments.name: timeout
arguments.summary: Sets a time limit for query execution, specified in milliseconds.

arguments.name: groupby
reduce
arguments.summary: Applies a reducer function, like `SUM` or `COUNT`, on grouped results.
Groups results by specified fields, often used for aggregations.

arguments.name: exists
arguments.summary: Checks whether a field exists in a document.

arguments.name: log
arguments.summary: Return the logarithm of a number, property or subexpression

arguments.name: abs
arguments.summary: Return the absolute value of a numeric expression

arguments.name: ceil
arguments.summary: Round to the smallest integer not less than x

arguments.name: floor
arguments.summary: Round to largest integer not greater than x

arguments.name: log2
arguments.summary: Return the logarithm of x to base 2

arguments.name: exp
arguments.summary: Return the exponent of x, e.g., e^x

arguments.name: sqrt
arguments.summary: Return the square root of x

arguments.name: upper
arguments.summary: Return the uppercase conversion of s

arguments.name: lower
arguments.summary: Return the lowercase conversion of s

arguments.name: startswith
arguments.summary: Return 1 if s2 is the prefix of s1, 0 otherwise.

arguments.name: contains
arguments.summary: Return the number of occurrences of s2 in s1, 0 otherwise. If s2 is an empty string, return length(s1) + 1.

arguments.name: strlen
arguments.summary: Return the length of s

arguments.name: substr
arguments.summary: Return the substring of s, starting at offset and having count characters. If offset is negative, it represents the distance from the end of the string. If count is -1, it means "the rest of the string starting at offset".

arguments.name: format
arguments.summary: Use the arguments following fmt to format a string. Currently the only format argument supported is %s and it applies to all types of arguments.

arguments.name: matched_terms
arguments.summary: Return the query terms that matched for each record (up to 100), as a list. If a limit is specified, Redis will return the first N matches found, based on query order.

arguments.name: split
arguments.summary: Split a string by any character in the string sep, and strip any characters in strip. If only s is specified, it is split by commas and spaces are stripped. The output is an array.

arguments.name: timefmt
arguments.summary: Return a formatted time string based on a numeric timestamp value x.

arguments.name: parsetime
arguments.summary: The opposite of timefmt() - parse a time format using a given format string

arguments.name: day
arguments.summary: Round a Unix timestamp to midnight (00:00) start of the current day.

arguments.name: hour
arguments.summary: Round a Unix timestamp to the beginning of the current hour.

arguments.name: minute
arguments.summary: Round a Unix timestamp to the beginning of the current minute.

arguments.name: month
arguments.summary: Round a unix timestamp to the beginning of the current month.

arguments.name: dayofweek
arguments.summary: Convert a Unix timestamp to the day number (Sunday = 0).

arguments.name: dayofmonth
arguments.summary: Convert a Unix timestamp to the day of month number (1 .. 31).

arguments.name: dayofyear
arguments.summary: Convert a Unix timestamp to the day of year number (0 .. 365).

arguments.name: year
arguments.summary: Convert a Unix timestamp to the current year (e.g. 2018).

arguments.name: monthofyear
arguments.summary: Convert a Unix timestamp to the current month (0 .. 11).

arguments.name: geodistance
arguments.summary: Return distance in meters.

arguments.name: filter
arguments.summary: Applies a numeric range filter to restrict results to documents with field values within the specified range.

arguments.name: dialect
arguments.summary: Sets the query dialect version to be used.

FT.PROFILE.summary: Performs a `FT.SEARCH` or `FT.AGGREGATE` command and collects performance information

arguments.name: index
arguments.summary: Specifies the name of the index. The index must be created using `FT.CREATE`.

arguments.name: limited
arguments.summary: Restricts profiling to the initial phase of the query execution.

arguments.name: query
arguments.summary: Specifies the query to profile and analyze performance.

arguments.name: index
arguments.summary: Specifies the name of the index. The index must be created using `FT.CREATE`.

arguments.name: index
arguments.summary: Specifies the name of the index. The index must be created using `FT.CREATE`.

FT.HYBRID.summary: Performs hybrid search combining text search and vector similarity search
FT.HYBRID.complexity: O(N+M) where N is the complexity of the text search and M is the complexity of the vector search
